a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This is a manuscript draft of the poem, "With Husky-Haughty Lips, O Sea!," which was first published in Harper's Monthly in March 1884. Reprinted in the "Sands at Seventy" annex to Leaves of Grass (1888).

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: With Husky⹀Haughty Lips, O Sea
bibl.orgName: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill: Walt Whitman Papers
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
The verso includes an unfolded international envelope to Walt Whitman and an illustrated advertisement for the Sheldon House in Ocean Grove, New Jersey.

lg.head: With husky⹀haughty lips, O sea
lg.l: Where day and night I walk thy surf⹀beat shore
Imaging to my sense thy varied strange suggestions,
Thy troops of white⹀maned racers urging to the goal,
Thy brooding murk and scowl—thy unloos'd hurricanes‸The ceaseless curious rapping of thy sands andw aves,—thy sudden changes

Thy ample smiling face, dash'd with the sparkling
dimples of the sun,

Great as thou art, thy many tears—a lack from
all eternity in thy content,

Thy lonely state—something thou ever seek'st
and seek'st, yet gainest not;
